put up.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to build something such as a wall, fence, building etc
put up.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: They’re putting up several new office blocks in the centre of town.
put up.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to put a picture, notice etc on a wall so that people can see it
put up.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Can I put up some posters?
The shops have started to put up Christmas decorations.
put up.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to attach a shelf, cupboard etc to a wall
put up.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: My dad put up five shelves.
put up.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to increase the cost or value of something
put up.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Most big stores admit they daren’t put prices up for fear of losing their customers.
put up.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to raise something to a higher position
put up.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: I put up my hand and asked to leave the room.
Philip put his hood up because it was raining.
put up.translation[0].definitions[5].def: to let someone stay in your house and give them meals
put up.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: I was hoping Kenny could put me up for a few days.
put up.translation[0].definitions[6].def: to stay in a place for a short time
put up.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: We can put up at a hotel for the night.
put up.translation[0].definitions[7].def: to show great determination to oppose something or get out of a difficult situation
put up.translation[0].definitions[7].exa: Gina put up a real fight to overcome the disease.
The rebels have put up fierce resistance.
put up.translation[0].definitions[8].def: to give an amount of money for a particular purpose
put up.translation[0].definitions[8].exa: The paper put up a reward for information on the murder.
put up.translation[0].definitions[9].def: to make something or someone available for a particular purpose
put up.translation[0].definitions[9].exa: They put their house up for sale.
The baby was put up for adoption.
put up.translation[0].definitions[10].de: to explain a suggestion or idea so that other people can think about it or discuss it
put up.translation[0].definitions[10].ex: If you can put up a good enough case, the board will provide the finance.
put up.translation[0].definitions[11].de: to suggest someone as a suitable person to be elected to a position
put up.translation[0].definitions[11].ex: I was put up for the committee.
put up.translation[0].definitions[12].de: used to tell someone that they should either do what needs to be done or stop talking about it
put up.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to increase the price, cost, or value of something
put up.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The bank put up its interest rates by 1%.
My landlord is putting the rent up.
put up.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to provide an amount of money for a particular purpose, especially to start a business
put up.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: He has agreed to put up $750 million for a 15% stake in the consortium.
Nearly £5 billion has been put up by private investors.
put up.translation[1].definitions[2].def: if you put up an asset as collateral for a loan, you obtain the loan on condition that the lender has the right to take and sell this asset if you fail to repay the loan
put up.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: The bank refused to give him a loan until he put his home up as collateral.
